channel.title: Reference on John Houghton

item.title: My Unix Commands
item.description: Transferring Files & Directories 1) Push to remote server rsync -a –progress ~/dir1 username@remote_host:destination_directory 2) Pull from remote server rsync -a –progress jhoughton-admin@qycprdsasas301.corp.intuit.net:/data/08/jhoughton-admin/output/stage1c.tar.gz ~/data rsync -a –progress deploy@pprdpytas300.corp.intuit.net:/data/08/jhoughton-admin/pgm/qbo_overlap_may2017.sas download/rsync Compression 1) tar -cvzf tarballname.tar.gz itemtocompress rsync -a –progress ~/Downloads/weka-3-8-2jre-x64.exe.zip j7033694483256@supervanadventures.com:/home/j7033694483256/html 2) compress files with a specific file extention tar -cvzf jpegarchive.tar.gz /path/to/images/*.jpg 3) unpacking gunzip filename.tar.gz 4) un tar-ing tar -xvf filename.tar –directory /target/directory (!!! directory is relative to current directory!
